item.title: Paracentesis
item.content:encoded:
Paracentesis kit
skin marker
gown
bouffant
sterile glovesx2
drape/sterile towels
chlorhexidine
6cc syringe for lido
20/50cc syringe for paracentesis
25" needle for lido
4x4s
urinal to waste extra fluid
urine cup for sterile specimen

Steps
use US to mark abd site w marker
sterilize area
open kit and drop everything onto it while chlorhex is drying
put urinal & specimen cup within reach
wear goggles/bouffant
open gloves
doff gown & gloves
poke with needle
remove needle and set aside
use syringe to drain from safety centesis needle

Question: How should a paracentesis be performed in second- and third-trimester pregnant patients?
Answer: %%An open supraumbilical or ultrasound-guided approach is preferred%%

item.title: Suture Supplies
item.content:encoded:
Suture kit
Sterile gloves
Saline bottle
18g to poke hole in saline
18g and 23/25g for lido
6/10cc syringe for lido

item.title: Elbow Bursitis US
item.content:encoded:
Elbow_Bursitis.mp4

The fluid is pretty clear and hypoechoic, so less likely to be an abscess. And the septations indicate it is more likely chronic.

item.title: GI Bleed Balloon Tamponade
item.content:encoded:
1. Test both balloon cuffs for leaks
  2. Tie/suture an NGT to Blakemore, terminating 3cm proximal to esophagus
  3. Place Blakemore, inflate gastric balloon w 50cc, clamp port, and XR confirm placement. If placement good, attach manometer with Y connector and inflate to 15mmHg then clamp port and detach
  4. Attach traction to Blakemore tubing with 500cc or 1L saline bag pulley w Curlex
  5. Suction gastric and NG tube to look for blood
  6. If blood in NGT, inflate esophageal balloon to 35-40mmHg

item.title: Pulmonary Contusion US
item.content:encoded:
This is just for patients with known significant chest trauma

Localized, focal area of B-lines are indicative of contusion

Pulm contusion C-line
This semicircular defect is lung contusion

item.title: Lung US Approach
item.content:encoded:
Use curvilinear unless looking for PTX


If there is concern for effusion or PNA, can start on the posterior views and identify the most posterior area, right above the kidney ↑

Here's xverse process of spine. ↑
Don't fan, but translate the probe across the back up, down, left, right.

Dr Avila lawnmowers with probe marker up and if he sees any abnormality he'll turn probe 90° to focus on it.

  • Scapula gets in the way, so you just gotta looks between the scapula and the spine.

item.content:encoded:
Central line kit
Sterile gloves
Bouffant
Eyewear

Large chlorhexidine swab

item.title: Arthrocentesis Supplies
item.content:encoded:
- 2% lidocaine
- 6 cc syringe
- 18 & 25 gauge needle for lidocaine

  • 18 or 20-gauge spinal needle
  • 20 or 30 cc syringe
  • Sterile gloves
  • Sterile towels
  • Sterile drape with hole or cut hole in sterile drape
  • Chlorhexidine
